definition: It is hard to change one's essential nature (idiom). You can't change who you are./Can the leopard change his spots? (Jeremiah 13:23)
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove
it is easier to change mountains and rivers than to alter one's character (idiom)/you can't change who you are/Can the leopard change his spots?
pinyin: jiang1 shan1 yi4 gai3 , ben3 xing4 nan2 yi2

sentences.english: Change of habit cannot alter Nature.
Nature is hard to be overcome, but she must be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 儘管本性難移，但是本性一定要移。

sentences.english: I don't think so. Can the leopard change its spots?
sentences.chinese: 我不這樣認爲，有道是江山易改，本性難移啊。

sentences.english: Change of scene is not change of nature.
sentences.chinese: 這正是江山易改，本性難移。

sentences.english: Mark:Now you know he won't change.
sentences.chinese: 現在你知道他本性難移了吧。

sentences.english: This is what we say" leopard change his spots".
sentences.chinese: 這就是我們俗話說的“江山易改本性難移”。

sentences.english: Now you know he won't change.
sentences.chinese: 現在你知道他本性難移了吧。

definition: indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
survival of the fittest
affectionate/an affectionate person
stratagem
source of calamity (esp. of women)
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
self-taught/to learn without a teacher (idiom)
man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
lit. having crossed the vast ocean (idiom)/fig. widely experienced in the vicissitudes of life
